question.body: With considering the role of the medullary interstitial, what is the difference between countercurrent exchange and countercurrent multiplication?

part.explanation: In countercurrent exchange, urea and sodium and chloride ions diffuse from the medullary interstitial fluid into the blood, which then allows water to diffuse from the blood into the interstitial fluid. The countercurrent multiplication mechanism, located in the loop of Henle, is responsible for the establishment of an osmotic gradient within the medullary interstitium.
